duties_responsibilities.duty: Designs, plans, executes, and interprets complex in vitro and ex vivo studies focused on understanding target biology and identifying small molecules for treatment of a broad range of therapeutic indications.
Evaluates pathway biomarkers and endpoints from in vivo studies and human disease samples via techniques such as flow cytometry, qPCR, IHC, ELISA and Western blots
Works effectively in a fast-paced, multidisciplinary setting of chemistry, biology, pharmacology, supported by external CROs
Participates in the evaluation of new targets
Identifies lead compounds with desirable properties from activity and selectivity data, DMPK characteristics, and physiochemical properties
Presents scientific data to multidisciplinary discovery teams
Participates in the evaluation of new targets
Aids in fostering a culture of authenticity, open communication, transparency, integrity, mutual respect, and freedom to brainstorm and share thoughts and ideas
Communicates effectively within project teams and work to progress against goals in a multidisciplinary setting

education_certification.credential: MS or PhD in physiology, molecular biology, immunology, neuroscience or relevant biological discipline
